study.name: BP30037 (Copy for Transcelerate)

versions.rationale: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Phase 2A Study to Assess the Efficacy of RO5459072 in Patients With Primary Sjogren's Syndrome

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN01
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Males and females 18 to 75 years of age, inclusive.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN02
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Patient willing to give written informed consent and to comply with the study procedures and restrictions.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN03
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Primary Sjögren's syndrome diagnosed previously according to the revised American-European Consensus Group (AECG) criteria.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN04
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: European League against Rheumatism (EULAR) Sjögren's Syndrome Disease Activity Index (ESSDAI) score ≥ 5.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN05
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: EULAR Sjögren’s Syndrome Patient Reported Index (ESSPRI) score ≥ 5.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN06
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Elevated serum titers at screening of anti-Sjögren's-syndrome-related antigen A (anti-SSA) and/or anti-SSB antibodies at screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN07
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Negative pregnancy test at screening and baseline (women only), and agreement to comply with measures to prevent pregnancy and restrictions on sperm donation

studyDesigns.name: Main Study Design
studyDesigns.description: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Phase 2A Study to Assess the Efficacy of RO5459072 in Patients With Primary Sjogren's Syndrome
studyDesigns.label: Main Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Phase 2A Study to Assess the Efficacy of RO5459072 in Patients With Primary Sjogren's Syndrome

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN01
eligibilityCriteria.label: Males and females 18 to 75 years of age, inclusive.

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN02
eligibilityCriteria.label: Patient willing to give written informed consent and to comply with the study procedures and restrictions.

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN03
eligibilityCriteria.label: Primary Sjögren's syndrome diagnosed previously according to the revised American-European Consensus Group (AECG) criteria.

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN04
eligibilityCriteria.label: European League against Rheumatism (EULAR) Sjögren's Syndrome Disease Activity Index (ESSDAI) score ≥ 5.

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN05
eligibilityCriteria.label: EULAR Sjögren’s Syndrome Patient Reported Index (ESSPRI) score ≥ 5.

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN06
eligibilityCriteria.label: Elevated serum titers at screening of anti-Sjögren's-syndrome-related antigen A (anti-SSA) and/or anti-SSB antibodies at screening.

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN07
eligibilityCriteria.label: Negative pregnancy test at screening and baseline (women only), and agreement to comply with measures to prevent pregnancy and restrictions on sperm donation

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX01
eligibilityCriteria.label: A diagnosis of secondary Sjögren's syndrome according to the revised AECG criteria.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX02
eligibilityCriteria.label: Severe complications of Sjögren's syndrome, such as vasculitis with renal, neurologic or cardiac involvement; interstitial lung disease and severe myositis,

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX03
eligibilityCriteria.label: Systemic immunosuppressant therapy (e.g., abatacept, azathioprine, ciclosporin, etanercept, tofacitinib), cyclophosphamide or B cell depleting therapy (e.g., rituximab anti-CD20 therapy) within 6 months prior to the screening visit. Low dose methotrexate treatment (i.e., oral doses ≤ 20 mg weekly) is, however, permitted.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX04
eligibilityCriteria.label: Corticosteroid therapy exceeding 7.5 mg prednisone equivalents per day.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX05
eligibilityCriteria.label: Mechanically stimulated whole salivary flow rate at baseline of < 0.1 mL/min.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX06
eligibilityCriteria.label: A positive test result for hepatitis B (HBV), hepatitis C (HCV), or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), or tuberculosis, or any other active viral, fungal, yeast or bacterial infection at the screening visit.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX07
eligibilityCriteria.label: A history of recurring or chronic infections, any other indication of reduced immune function considered to be clinically significant by the Investigator, or any other underlying conditions which may further predispose patients to serious infection.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX08
eligibilityCriteria.label: A history of lymphoma, myeloma (monoclonal hypergammaglobulinemia) or monoclonal gammopathy of unknown significance (MGUS), or any other malignancies within the past 5 years (except basal cell or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin that has been cured).

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX09
eligibilityCriteria.label: A diagnosis of fibromyalgia, or a diagnosis of significant depression or anxiety that in the opinion of the investigator would confound the interpretation of the study results.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX10
eligibilityCriteria.label: Severe renal impairment (e.g., estimated glomerular filtration rate < 30 mL/min), moderate or severe hepatic impairment (e.g., Child-Pugh B or C) or other clinically significant hepatic disease (e.g., AST, ALT or GGT > 2x upper limit of normal).

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX11
eligibilityCriteria.label: Current or a history of severe, progressive or uncontrolled hematologic, gastrointestinal, endocrine, pulmonary, cardiac, or neurologic disease, or any other concomitant disease or condition or any clinically significant finding at screening that could interfere with, or for which the treatment of might interfere with, the conduct of the study, or that would, in the opinion of the Investigator, pose an unacceptable risk to the individual in this study.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX12
eligibilityCriteria.label: Participation in an investigational drug or device study within 3 months prior to screening.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX13
eligibilityCriteria.label: Inability to comply with the study protocol for any other reason.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX14
eligibilityCriteria.label: Women who are lactating, breastfeeding or planning to nurse.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX15
eligibilityCriteria.label: Using other prohibited medication (moderate or potent inhibitors of CYP3A4; strong inducers of CYP3A4; strong inhibitors of the transporter P-glycoprotein [P-gp]; sensitive substrates of CYP3A4 with a narrow therapeutic index).

objectives.name: Primary Objective 1
objectives.description: To investigate the effects of RO5459072 treatment on disease activity and symptoms of primary Sjögren’s syndrome.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: Proportion of patients showing a clinically relevant decrease in ESSDAI score from baseline after 12 weeks.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 2
objectives.description: To investigate the effects of RO5459072 treatment on:quality of life measures.auto-antibody concentrations.pharmacodynamic measures of exocrine gland function.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: Proportion of individuals showing a clinically relevant decrease in ESSPRI score after 12 weeks where a clinically relevant decrease in ESSPRI score is defined as a decrease of ≥ 1 point.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 2
endpoints.description: Change from baseline in ESSDAI, ESSPRI and SF-36 scores after 12 weeks.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 3
endpoints.description: Change from baseline in each of the individual components of the ESSPRI (dryness, fatigue and pain) after 12 weeks.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.description: To collect samples for population modelling of RO5459072 pharmacokinetics.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: RO5459072 plasma concentration data will be pooled with data from other studies (Study WP29542 and Study BP29772) for population pharmacokinetic modelling. The modelling results will be reported separately.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.description: To investigate the safety and tolerability of RO5459072 treatment.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: The incidence and severity of AEs.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 2
endpoints.description: The incidence of SAEs or withdrawals because of AEs.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 3
endpoints.description: The incidence of out-of-reference-range values for vital signs and ECGs, and laboratory tests.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 4
endpoints.description: Change from baseline in vital signs and ECGs, and laboratory tests by visit.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 5
objectives.description: To investigate the effects of RO5459072 treatment on:cathepsin S enzyme mass and activity.sub-populations of circulating white blood cells.biomarkers connected to Sjögren’s syndrome.biomarkers of extracellular matrix degradation.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: Comparisons of the performance of alternative composite endpoints (e.g., Sjögren’s response index [SSRI-30]) as predictive markers of drug treatment response.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 6
objectives.description: To explore the influence of covariates on the effects of RO5459072 treatment.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: Change from Week 12 to follow-up for ESSDAI, ESSPRI and SF-36 scores in each treatment group.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 7
objectives.description: To explore alternative composite endpoints as measures for evaluating effects of drug treatment.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: Comparisons of drug treatment effects between genotypes.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 8
objectives.description: To explore the effects of RO5459072 treatment on the use of concomitant medications.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: Patterns of use of selected concomitant medications.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 9
objectives.description: To explore the occurrence of acute rebound phenomena on disease activity and symptoms following discontinuation of study drug treatment.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: Change from Week 12 to follow-up for ESSDAI, ESSPRI and SF-36 scores in each treatment group.

activities.name: 12 Lead ECG (Triplicate)
activities.label: 12 Lead ECG (Triplicate)
activities.description: Subject must be in supine position in a rested and calm state for at least 5 minutes before ECG assessment is conducted. If the subject is unable to be in the supine position, the subject should be in most recumbent position as possible. ECGs should be performed in a standardized method, in triplicate, and run consecutively. Each triplicate, which consists of three 10-second tracings, should be completed within a total of five minutes from the start of the first to the completion of the third, prior to blood draws or other invasive procedures. Each ECG must include the following measurements: QRS, QT, QTc, RR, and PR intervals. - Baseline ECGs should be collected at 3 timepoints ≥ [5] minutes apart, with each baseline ECG performed in triplicate, and with at least [5] minutes between the end of each triplicate and the start of the next (total 9 ECGs) - Each post-dose ECG should be performed in triplicate (total 3 ECGs)Baseline is defined as [study to define]. The PI [or (eg, designated site physician, central reader)] will review all ECGs. ECGs will be transferred electronically to an ECG central vendor [eg, for storage or for analysis]. Once signed, the original ECG tracing will be retained with the subject's source documents. At the request of the sponsor, a copy of the original ECG will be made available to the Sponsor. Standard ECG machines should be used for all study-related ECG requirements. In certain circumstances, the Sponsor may be able to provide a standard ECG machine if a site is unable to provide one. Study team to decide if wording is to be included in the protocol in this regard.

activities.name: CBC W Differential Panel by Unspecified Method, Blood
activities.label: CBC W Differential Panel by Unspecified Method, Blood
activities.description: In the Western world, most labs perform automated counts and we recommend that you use 57782-5.

activities.name: Stimulated Salivary Flow Test
activities.label: Stimulated Salivary Flow Test
activities.description: Stimulated saliva collection with paraffin wax involves the subject drooling into a funnel while chewing the wax for 3 minutes.  Stimulated saliva collection with sugar-free lemon drop candy involves the subject drooling into a funnel while chewing the candy for 3 minutes. An unstimulated salivary flow rate of 0.1 to 0.2 ml/min and a paraffin wax stimulated flow rate of 0.7 ml/min or less is considered to be abnormally low flow rates indicative of salivary gland hypofunction.  Dentists may also measure the salivary flow rate using a sialometer.

activities.name: Desmosine [Mass/Vol], Plasma
activities.label: Desmosine [Mass/Vol], Plasma
activities.description: Desmosine is an amino acid found uniquely in elastin, a protein found in connective tissue such as skin, lungs, and elastic arteries. Desmosine is a component of elastin and cross links with its isomer, isodesmosine, giving elasticity to the tissue.

activities.name: Cytokines Panel, Plasma
activities.label: Cytokines Panel, Plasma
activities.description: Used to report results for various cytokines, including Interferon gamma (IFN-gamma), Interleukin-1 beta (IL-1 beta), Interleukin-10 (IL-10), Interleukin-12 (IL-12), Interleukin-13 (IL-13), Interleukin-2 (IL-2), Interleukin-2 Receptor (IL-2R), Interleukin-4 (IL-4), Interleukin-5 (IL-5), Interleukin-6 (IL-6), Interleukin-8 (IL-8), Interleukin-17A (IL-17A), and Tumor Necrosis Factor alpha (TNF alpha). The cytokines or other immunoactive molecules included in the panel may vary across labs and within a lab over time. Those selected may also be based on the individual condition(s) being studied. Results are used to understand the pathophysiology of immune, infectious, or inflammatory disorders, or may be used for research purposes.

activities.name: Vital Signs
activities.label: Vital Signs
activities.description: This panel was created to collect the set of vital sign observations that was originally defined by HITSP and called the "Vital Sign Result Value Set" in the C80 Clinical Document and Message Terminology Component (Value Set OID: 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.80.62), but it is not limited for use in that context. This collection includes the standard vital sign measurements (heart and respiratory rate, blood pressure and body temperature) along with measurements for height, weight, head circumference (OFC), and oximetry.

activities.name: EULAR Sjogren's Syndrome Patient Reported Index (ESSPRI)
activities.label: EULAR Sjogren's Syndrome Patient Reported Index (ESSPRI)
activities.description: The ESSPRI is a patient-reported index designed to assess the severity of patients' symptoms in primary SS

activities.name: 36-Item Short Form Survey (SF-36)
activities.label: 36-Item Short Form Survey (SF-36)
activities.description: The SF-36 is a set of patient reported quality of life measures widely utilized for routine monitoring and assessment of care outcomes in adult patients.

activities.name: EULAR Sjögren’s Syndrome Disease Activity Index (ESSDAI)
activities.label: EULAR Sjögren’s Syndrome Disease Activity Index (ESSDAI)

activities.name: Whole mRNA Transcriptome Sequence Analysis, Blood
activities.label: Whole mRNA Transcriptome Sequence Analysis, Blood
activities.description: Whole mRNA transcriptome analysis by sequencing (RNA-Seq) is performed to determine what effect, if any, variants of unknown significance (VUS) may have on gene expression under specific circumstances or in a specific cell. Effect on the transcripts include a splice site defect, an inclusion of a pseudo-exon, exclusion of a real exon or loss of expression of the gene. Whole RNA transcriptome analysis is used in cancer diagnostics as well as other conditions to assess the functional impact of a variant on gene expression. While RNA-Seq studies looks at RNA transcribed from (mostly) exonic regions of DNA, whole exome sequencing studies [LOINC: 86205-2] look directly at the DNA contained in exonic regions of the genome. This term was created for, but not limited in use to, the submitter's MNG Whole Transcriptome assay, which is used to assess all genes in mRNA that are expressed in the specimen and identify changes that could be associated with the patient's clinical presentation. It is recommended that RNA-Seq assays are performed in the context of DNA sequencing results since some variants may not be detected in RNA.

activities.name: Complement C3 and C4 Panel [Mass/Vol], Serum or Plasma
activities.label: Complement C3 and C4 Panel [Mass/Vol], Serum or Plasma

activities.name: Coagulation Panel (PT/INR, aPTT), Platelet poor plasma
activities.label: Coagulation Panel (PT/INR, aPTT), Platelet poor plasma

activities.name: Troponin I Cardiac [Mass/Vol], Serum or Plasma
activities.label: Troponin I Cardiac [Mass/Vol], Serum or Plasma

activities.name: Urinalysis Macro Panel by Dipstick, Urine
activities.label: Urinalysis Macro Panel by Dipstick, Urine
activities.description: Depending upon the dipstick, the results for glucose, bilirubin, ketones and protein may be reported as an ordinal (present, absent or None, 1+, 2+, 3+,) or as a quantitative value (e.g. 25 mg/dL). The panel includes both versions to accommodate these two variations. However, one of each of the following four pairs must be included in the panel, so the required status is marked as "R-a" (Required with alternatives) to remind users that if one item in the pair is not included in the panel the other must be:        1) Glucose [Mass/volume], Glucose [Presence]        2) Bilirubin [Mass/volume], Bilirubin [Presence]         3) Ketones [Mass/volume], Ketones [Presence]        4) Protein [Mass/volume], Protein [Presence]

activities.name: HBV and HCV Screening and Diagnosis, Serum
activities.label: HBV and HCV Screening and Diagnosis, Serum
activities.description: This panel includes tests that are used to distinguish between hepatitis B and C infection in patients that have had symptoms of hepatitis for at least 6 months.

activities.name: Archived Sample, Tear
activities.label: Archived Sample, Tear
activities.description: Tear sample is taken and then may be placed into storage before future analysis

activities.name: Chemistry Panel (CHEM-14), Serum or Plasma
activities.label: Chemistry Panel (CHEM-14), Serum or Plasma
activities.description: The components of this panel were defined by HCFA (now CMS)

activities.name: Gamma Glutamyl Transferase [Act/Vol], Serum or Plasma
activities.label: Gamma Glutamyl Transferase [Act/Vol], Serum or Plasma

activities.name: Lymphocyte T-Cell, B-Cell and NK Subsets Panel, Blood
activities.label: Lymphocyte T-Cell, B-Cell and NK Subsets Panel, Blood

activities.name: Schirmer Test
activities.label: Schirmer Test
activities.description: The Schirmer test or Schirmer tear test (STT) is used to assess tear production, especially in patients with suspected keratoconjunctivitis sicca, dry eye, or tear overproduction.
